results.title: [Comparison between atenolol and verapamil in the treatment of unstable angina].
results.text_hl: [Comparison between @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@ in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Angina_Unstable</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000789 @@@unstable angina@@@].

results.title: Medical treatment of patients with severe exertional and rest angina: double blind comparison of beta blocker, calcium antagonist, and nitrate.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@Pain@@@ was abolished in four @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ relief was significantly better on @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ than on @CHEMICAL_isosorbide_5_mononitrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C030397 @@@isosorbide mononitrate@@@.

citations.NLM: Quyyumi AA, Crake T, Wright CM, Mockus LJ, Fox KM. Medical treatment of patients with severe exertional and rest angina: double blind comparison of beta blocker, calcium antagonist, and nitrate. Br Heart J. 1987 Jun;57(6):505-11. PMID: 3304367

results.title: A micromethod for the quantification of atenolol in plasma using high-performance liquid chromatography with fluorescence detection: therapeutic drug monitoring of two patients with severe coronary insufficiency before cardiac surgery.
results.text_hl: The analytical method was validated by the quantification of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in plasma obtained from 2 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Angina_Unstable</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000789 @@@unstable angina@@@, scheduled for myocardium revascularization surgery, who were chronically treated with 50 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ administered per os once a day.

citations.NLM: Leite Fda S, Pereira VA, Omosako CE, Carmona MJ, Auler JO Jr, Santos SR. A micromethod for the quantification of atenolol in plasma using high-performance liquid chromatography with fluorescence detection: therapeutic drug monitoring of two patients with severe coronary insufficiency before cardiac surgery. Ther Drug Monit. 2006 Apr;28(2):237-44. PMID: 16628137
citations.BibTeX: @article{16628137, title={A micromethod for the quantification of atenolol in plasma using high-performance liquid chromatography with fluorescence detection: therapeutic drug monitoring of two patients with severe coronary insufficiency before cardiac surgery.}, author={Leite Fda S and Pereira VA and Omosako CE and Carmona MJ and Auler JO Jr and Santos SR}, journal={Ther Drug Monit}, volume={28}, number={2}, pages={237-44}}

results.title: The value of routine non-invasive tests to predict clinical outcome in stable angina.
authors: TIBET (Total Ischaemic Burden European Trial) study group
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were then randomised to treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ or a combination of both.
